intro: Rosa canina var. raunkiaeri, commonly known as the Raunkiaer rose, is a variant of the dog rose native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of small, fragrant pink flowers. The plant produces oval, red-orange hips that are rich in vitamin C and are often used in herbal medicine. Its leaves are compound, with five to seven elliptical leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional remedies.
